IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
On April 28th, 2023 at approximately 1312 hours I was dispatched to 32791 Bluff Point Drive, Cordova, Talbot County, Maryland, for a report of an identify theft and fraud. Upon my arrival, I contacted Marie Denise Ann Mitchell (06/22/1980 2F) who stated her she believed her work email was hacked. Mitchell advised her company, Velocity HVAC, was scheduled to do work for a customer named Robert Burns Irvine 3rd (08/11/1965 2/M) on May 1st, 2023. Mitchell advised Irvine was sent an invoice using the Velocity HVAC software, which sent the invoice through email, but the recipient was unable to reply back to the email. Mitchell had a copy of the invoice email that was sent and provided a copy to me. The copy of the invoice provided showed an email address of notifications@housecallpro.com Underneath the email it showed a reply to address of denise@velocityhvac.com. The invoice was numbered 675430-2, dated April 11th, 2023 and the service listed was a fifty percent deposit for a total of $16,925. Mitchell then provided me emails she received from Irvine dated April 28th, 2023 at 1153 hours which stated “ Here it is, Denise”. The email was sent to velocityhvac2@gmail.com, which Mitchell advised was her personal account. Mitchell further pointed out all the email conversation between Irvine and an email address that matched her work email of denise@velocityhvac.com, but the emails in the chain were not in her email. I observed the email Irvine was using in the email chain was robbirvine@gmail.com. Mitchell stated she believed someone had hacked into her email account and somehow stopped the emails from Irvine from appearing in her inbox, yet she was still receiving emails from other customers. The email chain Mitchell provided to me stated the following:

On April 12th, 2023 at 1642 hours, Irvine utilized the email address robbirvine@gmail.com to send an email to denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com>. The subject line stated RE: Invoice 675430-2 due from Velocity HVAC - $16925.00. Irvine stated in the email “Denise, I paid this via my Bank of America bill pay. You should have a check in hand by 4/19. Thanks! Rob”.

The next email listed was dated April 14th, 2023 at 1318 hours from denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com> and stated the following:

        Hi Rob,

        Sorry for the late response, I have been out of the office since Tuesday evening. We were wondering if you can process this payment as Ach/EFT instead of check? We are having a hard time receiving mails these days due to counterfeit         check from one of our vendors and mail check getting lost. Can you please put a stop on the check Or we can destroy the check if we receive it in the future .Kindly advise if there is a form to b filled out to get this Ach/EFT done today         .we will be sending you our new banking information upon your
        
        Sorry for the inconvenience.
        
        Thank you
        
        Denise.
        
        Sent from Mail for Windows

The next email in the chain was from Irvine with the robbirvine@gmail.com account and dated April 14th, 2023 1415 hours. The email was sent to denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com> with the same subject as earlier. The email stated “I’ll call my bank to see if that’s possible. I’ll get back to you this afternoon”.

The next email within the chain was from denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com> and dated April 14th, 2023 at 1422 hours. The email was sent to Irvine at robbirvine@gmail.com and stated the following:

                Rob,

               Find our bank information for you to make ACH payments. Please let me know if you have any questions.

               USA BANK NA
               Routing number :122105155
               Account number 151708774121
    
              Thank you

              Denise.

              Sent from Mail for Windows


After reading all the emails provided, I noticed the following issues within the emails:
  1. In the email dated April 14th, 2023 at 1318 hours, I observed the “ch” in Ach was lowercased twice while in a second email dated April 14th, 2023 at 1422 hours the “ch” in Ach was capitalized (ACH)
  2. In the email dated April 14th, 2023 at 1318 hours, I observed the sentence “We are having a hard time receiving mails these days due to a counterfeit check from one of our vendors and mail check getting lost. In this sentence the “receiving mails” and “mail check getting lost” are not grammatically correct.
  3.  In the email dated April 14th, 2023 at 1318 hours, in the sentence “Can you please put a stop on the check Or we can destroy the check if we receive it in the future .”. This sentence has a capitalized “O” in or in the middle of the sentence and the “period” at the end of the sentence is spaced away instead of right after the last word.
  4. In the email dated April 14th, 2023 at 1318 hours, in the sentence “.we will be sending you our new banking information upon your”, I noticed the period was again spaced away from the last word and right next to the “w”. I also observed the “w” for the beginning of a new sentence was not capitalized and at the end of the sentence, the sentence is not complete
  5. In the email dated April 14th, 2023 at 1422 hours, I observed the “:” after routing number was again spaced away from the “r” in number and in the accounting number there was not a “:” utilized.
Based off these observations, I believe the email chain between Irvine and denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com> is not between Irvine and Mitchell from Velocity HVAC, but rather Irvine and an unknown offender spoofing the email of Mitchell to communicate with Irvine. Mitchell stated she had been in communication with Irvine earlier in the day and that US Bank needed a case number from law enforcement, and to speak to law enforcement, in order to freeze the account to potentially recover and money within the account. I contacted the US Bank Fraud division and provided the account number of 151708774121 and was advised the account was for a checking account. I was also advised the account possibly belonged to a Paul Fisher. I was then transferred between two different fraud departments and the intelligence department, multiple times, before being advised no one would be able to assist me as they were not allowed to speak to law enforcement and I would need to contact the Legal department. I also utilized wise.com/us/routing-number/us-bank to run the routing number that was provided. The routing number of 122105155 was listed to the US Bank in Arizona.
Mitchell did state that Velocity HVAC does not accept wire transfers, and there is a 1% service charge on the transfers. I asked Mitchell if I could look at her email account, which she agreed. I searched “Robb” in the search bar and located emails stating it was from Rob Irvine. In the email, there was two total emails in the chain. The first email was as follows:

                From: Rob Irvine <robbrivine@gmail.com>
                Sent:  Monday, April 24, 2023 6:06 PM
                To: denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com>
                Subject: Pay of 1 of 2 has been transferred

                Hi Denise,

                I was successfully able to wire you $16,025 this afternoon from my bank. It turns out the issue I had earlier was due to the browser I was using. Evidently, Bank of America’s development team didn’t test their software on Firefox!                 You will have the money by tomorrow.

                Can you send me an invoice for the balance? Our title company will issue you a check since they’re holding aside some of our settlement fees for repairs. I’d like to make sure you get that before the work is complete.

                Thanks, Kate!

                Rob

The second email in the chain was as follows:

                From: Rob Irvine <robbrivine@gmail.com>
                Sent:  Monday, April 26, 2023 6:06 PM
                To: denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com>
                Subject: Pay of 1 of 2 has been transferred

                Hi Denise,
    
                I just got word from my bank this morning that the wire transfer was refunded back to my account.The reason the funds were refunded was because I was transitioning from my personal  bank to another.I just issued a check. You                 should have it in hand by 4/28.

                Can you send me an invoice for the balance?

                Thanks, Kate!

                Rob

After reading the two emails, Mitchell advised she had not seen the emails before. I started looking at the two emails and ultimately started seeing similar grammar and punctuation mistakes in the second email, dated April 26th, 2023 0953 hours, compared to the first email. I was ultimately able to confirm later that the first email, dated April 24th, 2023 at 1806 hours was written by Irvine, which will be detailed below. I also noticed the email addresses used to email Mitchell was different from the original email address. The email address used to send these emails was robbrivine@gmail.com compared to robbirvine@gmail.com. I noticed within the last name of ‘Irvine’ the ‘I’ and the ‘R’ were switched. In the second email I also noticed the email was finished with the same ending of “Thanks, Kate! Rob”. I also observed there was not a space after the periods for two sentences. The sentences were ‘account.The’ and ‘another.I’. I also noticed there was a double space between ‘personal’ and ‘bank’ (personal  bank). This again led me to believe that an unknown offender created a fake email account for Irvine and utilized the email account to email Velocity HVAC making it seem he attempted to pay them the $16,925 but was having issues.

After leaving from Mitchell’s residence, I contacted Irvine on the phone. Irvine stated his correct email address was robbirvine@gmail.com. Irvine stated he had multiple email conversations with who he thought was Mitchell from Velocity HVAC. Irvine also stated that he had received phone calls from a Centreville, Maryland phone number and during one of the phone conversations Irvine recalled being asked about potentially paying through a wire transfer. I asked Irvine about the emails and if he noticed anything that seemed off and Irvine stated no. Irvine did mention that in one email, dated April 24th, 2023 at 1806 hours, he had typed the amount paid as $16,025 when the amount was actually $16,925. Irvine also stated he had typed the name ‘Kate’ at the end, compared to typing ‘Denise’. I asked Irvine if he would be able to send me a copy of all his email correspondences with Velocity HVAC, which Irvine stated he would compile all the emails and provide me copies. I then asked Irvine about the phone calls he had received and Irvine stated that on April 23rd, 2023, he had received a total of one phone calls, some of which were missed phone calls, from 410-490-1454, which I knew to be Mitchell’s phone number. Irvine also stated that on April 21, 2023, he received one phone call from the same phone number. Irvine stated he believed he had received phone calls from 410-490-1312, which I know is the phone number listed on the website for Velocity HVAC, as well but could not remember the date or see the calls in his call history log on his phone. Irvine stated he could not remember which number called him when he was discussing the possibility of paying from a wire transfer. I asked Irvine if he was certain the caller was Mitchell when they discussed the payment through wire transfer and Irvine stated he thought it was but could not be certain. Irvine did advise he would obtain a copy of his phone records from his phone service company and provide a copy to me with to confirm which phone number called him after April 11th, which was the day the invoice was originally sent.  

On April 29th, 2023, Mitchell contacted the Maryland State Police Easton Barrack and advised she saw an email, which had been sent on April 28th, 2023, which was from Rob Irvine, however the address was robbrivine@gmail.com. Mitchell asked if she should reply back to the email and I advised Mitchell not to reply at this time. Mitchell did forward the email to me, which stated the following:

                From: Rob Irvine <robbrivine@gmail.com>
                Sent: Friday, April 28, 2023 8:23:58 PM
                To:  denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com>; phillip velocityhvac.com  <phillip@velocityhvac.com>
                Subject: Invoice 675430-2 due from Velocity HVAC - $16925.00

                The wire transfer was refunded back to my accountAs discussed, I understand,I already issued a check on Tuesday. You should have it in hand by Monday.Also I have to pay you the remaining balance before you complete the work                 on Monday. For my paperwork, can you send me a new invoice for the last $16,925? Once I receive that, I’ll mail out the balance check.

I immediately noticed that in the email, the sender stated he issued a check on Tuesday, however in the email dated April 26th, 2023, 0953 hours, which was provided from Mitchell, the sender had stated the check was issued on Wednesday. The sender also stated that the check would be in hand by Monday, however in the email dated April 26th, 2023 at 0953 hours, the sender is originally stated the check would be in hand on 4/28. I also noticed this email again had similar grammar and punctuation errors as previously mentioned emails. In this particular email, I noticed the following errors:
  1. There was no space between the words ‘account’ and ‘as’, and the word ‘as’ had a capital ‘A’ in the middle of the sentence.
  2. There was no space after the comma between ‘understand’ and ‘I’ as well as no space after the period between ‘Monday’ and ‘Also’.
  3. The statement ‘I’ll mail out the balance check’ does not seem appropriate, compared to ‘I’ll mail out a check for the balance’.

On April 29th, 2023, I received and reviewed multiple emails from Irvine, between himself and Velocity HVAC. The emails to and from Irvine utilized the robbirvine@gmail.com address, which again was confirmed to be Irvine’s correct email address. The first email was dated April 10th, 2023 at 2101 hours, which listed a new proposal from Velocity HVAC. The proposal was sent from <notifications@housecallpro.com> and listed a reply-to address of Velocity HVAC denise@velocityhvac.com. The proposal email did include a financing link and information related to the application for the financing. The second email was sent from robbirvine@gmail.com to Weez <louisastovall00@aol.com>. This email contained the proposal sent from Velocity HVAC on April 10th, 2023 at 2101 hours. The third email provided was dated April 11th, 2023 @ 1133 hours and was sent from <notifications@housecallpro.com>. The reply-to email address this time was just listed as denise@velocityhvac.com. The fourth email provided was dated April 12th, 2023 at 1530 hours. The email was from <notifications@housecallpro.com> and again had a reply-to address of denise@velocityhvac.com. The email stated a job was scheduled with Velocity HVAC. The job was scheduled for Monday May 1st, 2023. All previous emails were sent to robbirvine@gmail.com. The fifth email provided was dated April 12th, at 1620 hours and was sent from robbirvine@gmail.com. The email was sent to Louisa Irvine <louisastovall00@aol.com>. The email stated “just fyi” and appeared to be a forwarded email from Irvine about the scheduled job.

The sixth email that Irvine had provided was sent from Irvine to denise@velocityhvac.com. The email was dated April 12th, 2023 at 1642 hours. The email stated the following:

                Denise, I paid this via my Bank of America bill pay. You should have a check in hand by 4/19. Thanks!
                Rob
The seventh email provided from Irvine was sent from denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com> to <robbrivine@gmail.com> and was dated April 14th, 2023 at 1318 hours. The email stated the following:
        
                Hi Rob,

                Sorry for the late response, I have been out of the office since Tuesday evening. We were wondering if you can process this payment as Ach/EFT instead of check? We are having a hard time receiving mails these days due to                 counterfeit check from one of our vendors and mail check getting lost. Can you please put a stop on the check Or we can destroy the check if we receive it in the future .Kindly advise if there is a form to b filled out to get this                 Ach/EFT done today .we will be sending you our new banking information upon your

                Sorry for the inconvenience
.
                Thank you

                Denise.
                Sent from Mail for Windows

The eighth email provided from Irvine was sent by Irvine from robbirvine@gmai.com to “denise velocityhvac.com” <denise@velocityhvac.com>. This email was dated April 14th, 2023 at 1415 hours and was a reply the previous email dated April 14th, 2023 at 1318 hours. Irvine stated the following:

                I’ll call my bank to see if that’s possible. I’ll get back to you this afternoon.

                Rob

The ninth email provided from Irvine was sent from denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com> to Irvine. The email was dated April 14th, 2023 at 1422 hours and was a reply to the previous email dated April 14th, 2023 at 1415 hours. The email stated the following:

                Rob,

                Find our bank information for you to make ACH payments. Please let me know if you have any questions.

                US BANK NA
                Routing number :122105155
                Account number 151708774121

                Thank you

                Denise.

                Sent from Mail for Windows

The tenth email provided from Irvine was a reply from Irvine to “denise velocityhvac.com” <denise@velocityhvac.com> and dated April 15th, 2023 at 2149 hours. The email stated the following:

                Denise,

                I’m getting an error from Bank of America when I try to submit this. Are you sure the routing # doesn’t have some zeros in front of the number?

                Rob

The eleventh email provided from Irvine was sent from denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com> to Irvine and dated April 16th, 2023 at 1927 hours. The email stated the following:

                Rob,

                Both the account number and the routing number are accurate. Please let me know if you can process this, or if not, I can send our additional banking information to complete this.

            Thank you

                Denise.

                Sent from Mail for Windows

I immediately noticed in this email the text ‘Thank you’ appeared different from the rest of the text. I observed the ‘Thank you’ was larger compared to the rest of the email.

The twelth email provided by Irvine was again sent from denise velocityhvac.com <denise@velocityhvac.com> to Irvine and dated April 17th, 2023 at 1025 hours. The email stated the following:

                Rob,

                Can you please follow up on the below request and let me know if you are able to get the payment done to our US bank or if I should forward you our Wells Fargo banking details?
 
                Thank you

                Denise.

                Sent from Mail for Windows

In this email I noticed the text for ‘Thank you’ was back to the original size in previous emails except the email dated April 16th, 2023 at 1927 hours.

The thirteenth email provided by Irvine was sent from Irvine to “denise velocityhvac.com” <denise@velocityhvac.com> and dated April 24th, 2023 at 1606 hours. The email stated the following:
               
                Hi Denise,

                I was successfully able to wire you $16,025 this afternoon from my bank. It turns out the issue I had earlier was due to the browser I was using. Evidently, Bank of America’s development team didn’t test their software on Firefox!                 You will have the money by tomorrow.

                Can you send me an invoice for the balance? Our title company will issue you a check since they’re holding aside some of our settlement fees for repairs. I’d like to make sure you get that before the work is complete.

                Thanks, Kate!

                Rob

The fourteenth email provided from Irvine was a forwarded email to denise velocityhvac.com” <denise@velocityhvac.com>. Per Mitchell and Irvine, this email was sent to attempt to see if Irvine’s emails were being sent to Mitchell, which Mitchell stated they were not. The email was dated April 28th, 2023 at 1142 hours.

NOTE: In the above emails provided from Irvine, some emails were already discussed and therefore the indicators I have observed have also been documented. I did not document those indicators a second time in these emails provided by Irvine.

On April 29th, 2023 I also made contact with TFC Mingos from the Maryland State Police Criminal Investigations Division. TFC Mingos stated he would be completing a subpoena on the email address robbrivine@g,ail.com, to attempt to obtain an IP address.

At this time I request this case remain open pending further investigation.

On May 2nd, 2023 at approximately 1255 hours, I made contact with Sue Thao, Assistant Vice President for U.S. Bank. Thao suggested Irvine contact Bank of America to see if a recall was attempted on the wire. Thao also asked if additional paperwork would be completed for the case. I asked Thao if a subpoena or a court order would be needed to obtain the bank records and to put a freeze on the account.  Thao's advised a court order would be required to freeze the bank account. 

I made contact with Irvine who stated he was currently completing a form for Bank of America that would allow them to call U.S. Bank on his behalf. I requested Irvine contact me with an update after the paperwork was submitted. Irvine provided a copy of the Scam Victim Acknowledgement form he signed. The BASS Claim number from Bank of America is 28APR2023-859237. A copy of the form was uploaded to the attachment section.     

I request this case remain open pending further investigation.

Investigators submitted a subpoena to Google pertaining to email address identified as "robbrivine@gmail.com." Goog,e responded to the subpoena and provided the following information: 
  • Account Created: April 26, 2023
  • Terms of Service IP: 185.182.193.32
  • Recovery SMS: +27684151389 (ZA) [South Africa]
The IP address was queried in the American Registry for Internet Numbers and found to originate in the Netherlands. 

Case open, investigation continuing.

Since the subscriber information was obtained placing the suspect(s) in the Netherlands, contact has been made with both involved parties who are awaiting information from their respective banks' fraud departments. Contact will be amide in the near future to determine if the banks obtained any further information regarding this investigation as well as if any matters of dispute have been resolved. 

Case open, investigation continuing.

At the time of this report, both financial institutions are in the process of resolving the issue pertaining to the returning the funds. All investigative leads have been exhausted pertaining to identifying the suspect(s) due to the location from which the criminal activity originated. All investigative leads have been exhausted. 

Case suspended.
